bibl.title: Despatch from Charles H. J. Taylor to James D. Porter, August 13, 1887
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: U.S. Consulate Series Monrovia Li August 13th, '87
Chas. H. J. Taylor to Hon. Jas. D. Porter
Report of Geo. E. Eminsary for 2nd quarter ending June 30th 1887, U.S. Consular ag't at Elmina, Gold Coast Cd
1. Summary of business. 2. Digest of the invoice book. 3. Arrival and departures of A'a vessels. 4. Detailed report of official service.
No. 8. U.S. Consulate Gen't Series Monrovia Liberia August 13th 1887
Hon Jas D. Porter Ass't Secretary of State Washington D.C.

Sir: I have the honor to herewith transmit the Report of George E. Eminsary U.S. Consulate agent at Elmina, Cape Coast Castle, W. C. Africa, for the 2nd quarter ending June 30th 1887. I hope the report may be formed to be correct. I have the honor in this connection to say, that I do not think it wise to nominate Consular agents for Cape Palmas and Grand Basas until such time as I am permited by the Department to visit said places, in view of present native difficulties rc., I am Sir,
